info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 09 at 2:33PM PDT until April 11 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM SUNDAY TO 11 PM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Moderate snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches with higher elevations seeing up to 21 inches. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Southern Oregon Cascades from Highway 140 northward. This includes Highways 51, 62, 138, and 140. This also includes Crater Lake, Diamond Lake, Crescent Lake and the resort at Willamette Pass. This also includes Union Creek. * WHEN...From 5 PM Sunday to 11 PM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility to near white out conditions at times. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow will occur Sunday night through Monday morning. Be prepared for periods of near white out conditions. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
